document.docTitle: Phellinocis thayerae Lopes-Andrade & Lawrence, 2005, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Phellinocis, a new genus of Neotropical Ciidae (Coleoptera: Tenebrionoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phellinocis, a new genus of Neotropical Ciidae (Coleoptera: Tenebrionoidea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species differs from both
P. erwini
and
P. romualdoi
in having diverging pronotal horns and paired subtriangular frontoclypeal plates in the male, slight pronotal and frontoclypeal modifications in the female, and a much smaller setal patch on first ventrite.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–20.
Phellinocis thayerae
sp. nov.
, male. 17. Body, dorsal view. 18. Anterior part of pronotum and head, dorsal view. 19. Part of elytra (arrow) and abdomen, ventral view. 20. Base of abdomen, ventral view, showing setal patch (arrow). Scale bars: 0.5 mm (Fig. 17); 0.1 mm (Figs. 18, 20); 0.3 mm (Fig. 19).

FIGURE 21.
Phellinocis thayerae
sp. nov.
, male genitalia showing the ninth segment (ix), tegmen (teg) and median lobe (ml). Arrow pointing to apex of tegmen. Scale bar: 0.1 mm.

paragraph.emphasis: Va r i a t i o n

subSubSection.paragraph: Total length 0.9–1.6 mm . Measurements in 15 ɗɗ & 15 ΨΨ: TLɗ 1.1–1.45 ( 1.31 ± 0.10 ), TLΨ 1–1.55 ( 1.26 ± 0.14 ); PLɗ 0.44–0.56 ( 0.51 ± 0.04 ), PLΨ 0.36–0.56 ( 0.48 ± 0.05 ); PWɗ 0.54–0.68 ( 0.60 ± 0.04 ), PWΨ 0.46–0.7 ( 0.61 ± 0.06 ); ELɗ 0.64–0.8 ( 0.73 ± 0.05 ), ELΨ 0.6–0.92 ( 0.78 ± 0.08 ); EWɗ 0.56–0.68 ( 0.63 ± 0.04 ); EWΨ 0.5–0.74 ( 0.65 ± 0.06 ). Ratios: BL/EWɗ 1.90–2.06 ( 1.96 ), BL/EWΨ 1.82 –2.0 ( 1.94 ); PL/PWɗ 0.81–0.9 ( 0.84 ), PL/PWΨ 0.74–0.85 ( 0.82 ), EL/EWɗ 1.12–1.19 ( 1.16 ), EL/EWΨ 1.12–1.27 ( 1.18 ); EL/PLɗ 1.36–1.54 ( 1.45 ), EL/PLΨ 1.44–1.83 ( 1.54 ). Color varies from yellow or yellowish­brown to black. Smaller males with raised, emarginate pronotal plate, the sides of which are subparallel, and with more weakly developed frontoclypeal plates. Female specimens with anterior edge of pronotum slightly elevated, usually forming paired tubercles, frontoclypeal region with pair of small, widely separated tubercles, and first ventrite simple.
